dataset.p: The dataset contains wildfire images collected from satellite sources and includes metadata such as acquisition dates, regions, satellite names, and instruments used. This dataset is essential for wildfire analysis and research in Azerbaijan. Since such a project had never been done in Azerbaijan before, creating a database was challenging and had to be done from scratch. The dataset can be downloaded as a .zip file that includes one folder with images and a CSV file containing comprehensive metadata about the collected images.

team.p1: This project was developed by ADA University students: Ahmad Huseynli, Turgay Farhadli, Gunel Aliyeva, and Sahil Guluzada. Their dedication and teamwork ensured the creation of this innovative platform to improve wildfire visualization and research capabilities in Azerbaijan.
team.p2: The team specializes in software development, data visualization, and project management, contributing their unique skills to deliver this impactful solution. Ahmad worked on visualization, Gunel on data processing, Sahil on synthetic wildfire image creation and website design, and Turgay on developing a wildfire detection model from satellite imagery.

project.p: The Wildfire Satellite Image Viewer aims to address the lack of tools for wildfire visualization in Azerbaijan. It provides users with the ability to filter wildfire images by region, time, satellite type, and other criteria. The platform's interactive map and user-friendly design make it a valuable resource for researchers, environmentalists, and policymakers.
project.projectInfo: The project combines satellite data analysis, modern web development techniques, and a focus on usability to deliver a comprehensive solution for wildfire monitoring and data accessibility.
